item.title: Small Business Lead Generation Tools
item.description:
Small Business Lead Generation Tools

I know, monster list posts are so last year, but I wanted to put together a resource that could be a bit of a guide as you navigate all of the various platforms, networks, and channels available today.

item.title: Answers To Your Tough Questions About Growth - Learned While Scaling Eventbrite's $5B+ Growth Engine
item.description:
Answers To Your Tough Questions About Growth - Learned While Scaling Eventbrite's $5B+ Growth Engine

Several years ago, Eventbrite knew it needed to get serious about growth. Fast forward and last year alone, it powered 2 million events in 180 countries. But it didn't all just happen. As the numbers and expectations grew larger through the years, so did the importance of more deeply understanding its key business levers, better relating to its customers' needs, and pushing its underlying growth drivers.

item.title: Developer Marketing Guide
item.description:
Developer Marketing Guide

Danielle Morrill joined Twilio in 2009 as Director of Marketing as the community grew from a few hundred developers to more than 100,000 members. She is currently the co-founder & CEO of Mattermark. During her Heavybit Speaker Series presentation, Morrill touts the advantages of simple yet effective marketing tools.

item.title: Copywriting formulas (don't write from scratch!)
item.description:
Copywriting formulas (don't write from scratch!)

This one post will help you write all your copy faster and with greater likelihood of success. You should be using copywriting formulas whenever you write anything. They eliminate the guesswork that makes a lot of bad copy bad copy. They will help you face the Blank White Page without cowering.

item.title: SumoMe, free tools to grow your website traffic.
item.description:
SumoMe, free tools to grow your website traffic.

May 3rd, 2016 by Eduardo Yi How does a 25% boost in monthly revenue sound? That's how much email marketing contributes to our six-figure per year business, ClickMinded. You may be thinking "oh, marketing emails are just annoying - I usually send them to the spam folder."

item.title: Startup Tools: 300+ Most Useful Apps, Software, and Other Resources
item.description:
Startup Tools: 300+ Most Useful Apps, Software, and Other Resources

Startup Tools: 300+ Most Useful Apps, Software, and Other Resources This has become a sort of living document. As we come across more and more resources, we will add them note the date they were added. So you've got an awesome idea for a product/app/service/software/website, but what now?

item.title: PR For Startups: The Art of the Press Release in 7 Steps
item.description:
PR For Startups: The Art of the Press Release in 7 Steps

Editor's Note: Today's post comes from Conrad Egusa, CEO of Publicize and a 500 Startups Mentor specializing in PR and media. PR can be INCREDIBLY important for startups -- not only as a one-time bump in growth but also for long-term amplification of your good efforts.

item.title: How to Send Email Like a Startup
item.description:
How to Send Email Like a Startup

A guide to optimizing your transactional emails, marketing emails, and customer relationship as a whole

item.title: The 2016 EyeEm Awards Are Now Open - EyeEm Blog
item.description:
The 2016 EyeEm Awards Are Now Open - EyeEm Blog

Say hello to the 2016 EyeEm Awards. Where 100,000s of photos are entered into five categories, with 100 of them getting exhibited and published. And where one ultimate winner is crowned EyeEm Photographer Of The Year. It's the largest contest for up-and-coming photography talent - and it's all about celebrating you, the EyeEm Community.
